conbody.p: You can use the SenSage AP Nearline Storage Server (NSS) to archive data to the following Nearline storage devices:

li.p: This module allows your organization to take advantage of the unique compliance features that Centera provides. The EDW uses the proprietary Centera API to move data to and from the Centera device.

li.b: Remote NFS (Network) or CIFS (Common Internet) File System
li.p: Remote file systems allow your organization to archive historical data to regular storage devices on remote hosts. The remote file systems are mounted locally on the hosts where the EDW instance runs. The local mount points on all EDW hosts must be the same, but each mount point can reference a different remote file system.

ul.li: Easier management of storage space. Scheduling the archiving of data to Nearline storage helps you maintain sufficient local storage space for EDW instances.
Easier expansion of storage space. If you require more space, add more storage to your SenSage AP-supported Nearline storage device.

More evenly balanced data loads on EDW hosts. When you add hosts to an EDW instance, the newer hosts initially have less data on them than the older, existing hosts. Because older data is archived before newer data, older hosts in the EDW instance are generally the first to reclaim local storage space.
Automatic retrieval of archived data. When people run queries, they do not need to know whether the are retrieved from local or Nearline storage.
